alert.note: Alert for Big Island South; Kohala; Kona (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 10 at 3:35AM HST until January 11 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU, KAUAI, OAHU, MOLOKAI, AND FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY UNTIL TUESDAY NIGHT FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .A large northwest swell has peaked and will briefly drop below warning levels today. However, a new larger swell will arrive by tonight and quickly push surf heights above the warning level yet again for the north and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai and Oahu; and the north facing shores of Maui. Surf for the west facing shores of the Big Island will remain at advisory levels. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Surf at 6 to 8 feet. * WHERE...West facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution.
